treasury_media.title: Alisa CL Choong on LinkedIn: Improving business decisions and accelerating time to value boosts
treasury_media.description: Improving business decisions and accelerating time to value boosts competitive advantage. Digital technologies can transform Shell’s ability to increase efficiency, reduce carbon footprint and improve employee value proposition. Quantifying and visualising uncertainties can reveal opportunities to adapt strategy to deliver more robust results. To do so, we tirelessly work to leverage new technologies.

projects.title: Peer-to-Peer Energy Trading and Sharing
projects.description:
The future electrical grid will have unprecedented complexity and uncertainty. The cost of low carbon technologies (such as PV, EV, storage and heat pumps) is rapidly decreasing and they are increasingly being connected to the edge of the grid. Millions of businesses and homes, which were traditionally passive energy consumers, will become energy prosumers that can store, convert and/or generate energy enabling them to be an active actor. Each actor will make independent decisions to pursue their own goals. These emerging traits make conventional centralised control, dispatch and scheduling tools no longer fit for purpose. The rise of prosumers, where energy buyers and sellers become increasingly blurred, is far beyond the capability of the current market and system operation framework [Hardy, Ofgem 2015]. The vision of this programme is to address this complex problem by providing strategic direction towards a horizontal energy supply, demonstrate its technical and commercial feasibilities and potential benefits to prosumers, communities and the grid in both Korea and the UK.
The key aim of this consortium is to manage large rapid influx of DERs (e.g. in the Southwest of UK) through increase horizontal energy collaboration/transaction management, thus substantially reduce the integration challenge to the vertical supply system. Managing millions of independent actors, each with a differing value proposition and each having changing levels of variability and uncertainty, is extremely challenging, as minor optimisation errors at the individual level can build into major failures and inefficiencies at the regional and system level. Thus, the strategic research question we are addressing is, 

"How to align the technical and market arrangements with diverse social requirements, such that 'selfish and independent' goals pursued by millions of customers are aligned with the interests of the communities and the system?"

contributors.headline: CEng, Principal Data Scientist, Industrial Electrification at Shell

projects.title: Development Plan for Lula Oilfield
projects.description: The Development Plan is a document that every oil operator company must submit to the Oil and Gas Agency, detailing the resource exploration strategy. This document is grounded in the reservoir model, economic analysis and technical specifications. I was responsible for four chapters: Executive Summary, Exploitation History, New Projects Strategy, and Long Term Oil and Gas forecasting. The document was internally approved by Petrobras managers in may 2016, containing around one thousand pages (the part I was directly involved contained two hundred pages).

contributors.headline: CEng, Principal Data Scientist, Industrial Electrification at Shell

projects.title: 2015 Petrobras Annual Business Plan
projects.description: Defined the 2015 risk analysed oil and gas production goal for the pre-salt polygon portfolio using reservoir, resources and operations premisses. This goal was one of the inputs for Petrobras four-year Management and Business Plan.

contributors.headline: CEng, Principal Data Scientist, Industrial Electrification at Shell

projects.title: Fat Loss Problem Modeling
projects.description: My systems model for this highly complex problem, that involves several mechanisms at work in the human body, in a quantitative view. This project presented the operational researcher's view on this issue, as well as the linear programming for finding a suitable weekly diet according to individual inputs like exercise pattern, body measurements and personal taste.

Professor Adjunto da UNIRIO e Prof Convidado Titular na UFRJ, Coordenador do PSIGMA at Federal University of the State of Rio de Janeiro

projects.title: 2011 Spare Parts Management and Optimization Workshop
projects.description: I coordinated the Spare Parts Management and Optimization workshop, hiring a consultancy company called Assetsman. The goal was the definition of an inventory policy in the light of our asset's lifecycle, considering a cost-effective deployment, operation, maintenance, upgrades, and disposal of equipments. This approach enriched the integration between reliability analysis and supply chain processes.

projects.title: Shared Inventories for Refining Operations
projects.description: Designed and implemented a Data Envelopment Analysis model for interchangeable material selection for corporate spare parts inventory for Brazilian refineries: This project required a systems modelling of the problem via extensive research and interviews with the process stakeholders, followed by the development of an operational research model, which was refined with mathematical support from UNIRIO - State University of Rio de Janeiro. The result allowed the reduction from USD 5.7 million to USD 4.2 million of spare-parts inventory value, without compromising operations.

profile_positions.description: I am technically responsible for the delivery of the digital scope for Industrial Electrification. I lead a group of 13 technical leads, each responsible for one team of 3 to 5 professionals who are building the technology blocks that will enable Shell's electrification strategy for industrial assets.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Electrification, Principal Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
I managed the Shell.ai Platform, our portfolio of cloud platform services (Azure and AWS) focused at scaling AI and Machine Learning in Shell. The Shell.ai Platform empowers our 1000+ data scientists developers to enable $2+ bln in digital applications and services.

I am responsible for multiple teams that acquire and integrate market standard cloud computing services into Shell's systems (technology, processes, people).
profile_positions.title: Artificial Intelligence Platform Manager

profile_positions.description: Responsible for implementing machine learning computational technology that enables data scientists to leverage cloud technology while building digital products to Shell businesses. The multifunctional and cross-company team I led was responsible for developing the enterprise-wide managed Azure Machine Learning Service.
profile_positions.title: Digital Engineering, Machine Learning Tools Lead

profile_positions.description: Lead a team of 6 analysts and data scientists. My team is focused on maturing proof of concepts into analytics and data science products, with appropriate governance and security, through Agile software development and DevOps methodologies.
profile_positions.title: Advanced Analytics, Technical Lead

profile_positions.description: I was the team focal point for asset management, delivering data science and operational research projects for deep water and unconventional fields. Strategically, I have influenced and refocused the team towards high business value projects, coaching team members in principles such as detailed scoping, valuation and prioritisation frameworks.
profile_positions.title: Advanced Analytics, Petroleum Engineer

profile_positions.description: Drove asset efficiency for the utilities industry through data science projects, turning raw data into actionable business intelligence, while actively developing junior scientists and engineers. As a senior scientist I was responsible for commercial activities such as pre-sales processes, customer engagements, requirement definition and proposal preparation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

company.name: University of Bath School of Management

profile_positions.company: University of Bath School of Management
profile_positions.description: My research extends the risk-return relationship, from portfolio optimisation theory, for energy demand aggregation based on time-series forecasting and evolutionary optimisation. I hypothesise that a portfolio of customers, chosen through maximising the forecast accuracy, would be an ideal trading object within a peer-to-peer energy marketplace.
profile_positions.title: New Energies Researcher

profile_positions.description: Performed reservoir engineering, production forecast and optimisation roles for Petrobras' pre-salt portfolio, collaborating with stakeholders such as project managers, executives and the regulatory agency.
profile_positions.title: Production & Reservoir Engineer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the corporate supply chain management governance of 12 units across Brazil, and for liaising with asset management teams.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Engineer

profile_positions.description: Evaluated Customer Relationship Management processes adherence in SAP Utilities systems projects (gas and electricity distribution companies).
profile_positions.title: Graduate Consultant for Utilities

profile_positions.description: Industrial engineer trainee in the quality control department at the cosmetics factory.
